content.content: Focus On #10: MIP6 vs. TradFi        For the 10th episode of Focus On, we will host Eric Rapp @Eumenes from @Real-World-Finance and Christian Petersen @christiancdpetersen from the incubating Legal & Transaction Services Core Unit to discuss the MIP6 process vs. TradFi deal assessments. Our guests will first discuss the MIP6 process by reviewing the framework for fact-based assessments and the role of RWF core unit(s) within the process. The team will then explore comparable aspects of TradFi Structured Finance Transactions and how the roles of borrowers & lenders translate to MakerDAO’s MIP6 framework. The team will conclude with a review of an off market transaction example, with a deep dive into specific metrics. The community will have a chance to have their questions answered at the end of the presentation.  Join us!  @juan & @retro will host.  When Time in your local-timezone format: 2022-04-20T15:00:00Z Mark it on your Google Calendar!  Where    crowdcast    Focus On #10: MIP6 vs. TradFi Register now for Focus On #10: MIP6 vs. TradFi on crowdcast, scheduled to go live on April 20, 2022, 10:00 AM CDT.      Attn:  @Recognized-Delegates, @GovAlpha-Core-Unit, @Risk-Core-Unit, @SES-Core-Unit, @Protocol-Engineering, @Growth-Core-Unit, @Oracles-Core-Unit, @gov-comms-core-unit, @collateral-core-unit, @happiness-core-unit, @dux-core-unit, @data-insights-cu, @immunefi-core-unit, @strat-fin-core-unit

Focus On Call - Episode #10  April 20th, 2022  Agenda   00:00: Intro with Christian Petersen.  00:44: Discussion and Questions with Christian Petersen and Eric Rapp.  57:24: Outro   Video https://youtu.be/ThYFPDsDbp8  Introduction  Christian Petersen  Agenda and Preamble 00:00  Good afternoon. Thanks for taking the time to speak with us. I am Christian Petersen, @christiancdpetersen on the forum. I am with with Eric Rapp, who is @Eumenes on the forum. We are here to discuss the differences between TradFi and the MIP6 process with Maker. For other episodes of FO, please check the forum.   Discussion  Christian Petersen and Eric Rapp 00:44  TradFi versus MIP61920×979 104 KB   Outline1634×930 94 KB   MIP6 Assessment - Facts1632×931 240 KB   MIP6 Role of Assessor & Legal1632×932 193 KB   MIP6 Role of Assesor1633×932 102 KB   Role of RWF and LTS1631×926 118 KB   TradFi: Doing a Structured Finance Transaction1634×932 114 KB   Lender and Borrower Priorities1630×930 137 KB   Borrower Seeks Financing1632×929 140 KB   Borrower Prepares & Proposes1630×931 121 KB   Initial Engagement1631×932 121 KB   Term Sheet Stage1634×933 141 KB   Post Term Sheet to Closing1632×934 134 KB   Many, Many Key Terms in Transactions, Including1634×934 149 KB   Off Market Transaction Examples1634×932 139 KB   TradFi vs. DeFi Onboarding Process1631×930 214 KB   Self-Contained MIPxx with "Prioritization"1630×931 316 KB   Questions 47:07 - Retro: How many of the challenges that you described are addressed or it is not addressed in the current version of MIP67 ? 50:24 - Eli Cohen: Can you provide any information about the current prioritization list? Which MIPs are in what order? 52:36 - David Krett: What is the motivation for using Maker as a funding source?  Closing Comment  Retro  Outro 57:24  I want to thank Christian Petersen and Eric Rapp for all the good content today. Thank you, everyone, for joining. We will see you in the forums.   Credits  Kunfu-po produced this summary.  @gala produced this summary. Everyone who spoke and presented on the call, listed in the headers.
